Module Stratego
Package com.stratego

Class GameDriver

java.lang.Object
com.stratego.GameDriver
public class GameDriver
extends java.lang.Object
A singleton that contains the shared information used between the different JFrames that make up the user interface and provides a way to handle state changes throughout the game.
Author:
Clint Mooney

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  GameDriver.GameState
    Provides a list of the possible states the game can be in.
    private class  GameDriver.StateChangeListener
    Defines the ActionListener to be passed through the singleton that will listen for interactions with the GUI that demand a change in either the state of the game or the display.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private static GameDriver instance
    Stores the current instance of the GameDriver class
    private static boolean isFullScreen
    Denotes whether the game should be displayed in fullscreen.
    private boolean sound
    Indicates whether the game is able to play sound (Unused).
    private static java.awt.event.ActionListener stateChangeListener
    Provides a universal implementation of the StateChangeListener class.
    private static javax.swing.JFrame view
    Stores the current JFrame that is being displayed.
    private GameDriver.GameState viewState
    Records the current GameState that the game is in.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Modifier Constructor Description
    private GameDriver()
    Creates an instance of the GameDriver class; utilizes the private keyword to ensure that it can be initialized outside of the use of the getInstance method.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void changeViewState​(GameDriver.GameState newState)
    Changes the state of the game based on the specified newState and updates the GUI accordingly.
    static GameDriver getInstance()
    Ensures that the GameDriver has only one instance by initializing only if instance currently is null.
    java.awt.event.ActionListener getStateChangeListener()
    Allows for the program to access the instance's stateChangeListener.
    boolean isFullScreen()
    Returns whether the view is being displayed in fullscreen.
    boolean isSoundOn()
    Returns the boolean which indicates whether the game should play sound.
    static void openView()
    Assigns view to a new MainMenuView to open the GUI.
    void toggleFullScreen()
    Toggles whether the GUI displayed currently is in fullscreen mode and displays the GUI with the new JFrame.
    void toggleSound()
    Toggles sound to the opposite of its current state.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static GameDriver getInstance()
      Ensures that the GameDriver has only one instance by initializing only if instance currently is null.
      Returns:
      instance.

    • openView

      public static void openView()
      Assigns view to a new MainMenuView to open the GUI.

      public boolean isFullScreen()
      Returns whether the view is being displayed in fullscreen.
      Returns:

    • toggleFullScreen

      public void toggleFullScreen()
      Toggles whether the GUI displayed currently is in fullscreen mode and displays the GUI with the new JFrame.

    • isSoundOn

      public boolean isSoundOn()
      Returns the boolean which indicates whether the game should play sound.
      Returns:
      sound (Unused).

    • toggleSound

      public void toggleSound()
      Toggles sound to the opposite of its current state.

    • changeViewState

      private void changeViewState​(GameDriver.GameState newState)
      Changes the state of the game based on the specified newState and updates the GUI accordingly.
      Parameters:
      newState - the destination GameState which the game should transition to.

    • getStateChangeListener

      public java.awt.event.ActionListener getStateChangeListener()
      Allows for the program to access the instance's stateChangeListener.
      Returns:
      stateChangeListener
